servinfo.title: DTC P0102 / P0103: Mass Air Flow Circuit Low / High Input

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0101: Mass Air Flow Circuit Range / Performance .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: DTC P0102: Mass Air Flow Circuit Low Input

entry.ptxt: Output voltage of MAF sensor is less than 0.3 V for 1 second or longer.

ptxt.emph: DTC P0103: Mass Air Flow Circuit High Input

entry.ptxt: Output voltage of MAF sensor is more than 0.5 V for 1 second or longer.

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC by using scan tool if any.
Start engine and run it for 10 sec.
Check DTC by using scan tool.

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: MAF sensor and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.

testgroup.question: Is normal value indicated?

action.ptxt: Intermittent trouble. Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.title: MAF sensor power supply voltage check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from MAF sensor with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper terminal connection to MAF sensor and ECM connectors
If connections are OK, turn ignition switch to ON position.
Check that MAF sensor power supply voltage is battery voltage.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Repair or replace MAF sensor power supply circuit.

test1.ptxt: Check that MAF sensor circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of each MAF sensor signal circuit and ground circuit is less than 3 Ω.
Insulation resistance between MAF sensor signal circuit and vehicle body ground is Infinity.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between MAF sensor signal terminal and each other terminal at MAF and IAT sensor connector.
Circuit voltage of each MAF sensor signal circuit and ground circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.

testgroup.title: MAF sensor signal check

test1.ptxt: Connect connectors to MAF sensor and ECM.
Check MAF sensor signal voltage referring to Mass Air Flow (MAF) and Intake Air Temperature (IAT) Sensor On-Vehicle Inspection .

testgroup.question: Is each value within specified range?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known good ECM and recheck.
